Text.Value: Hm. I thought I sniffed a Merregon's scent somewhere. These must've been a pain to get a hold of.
It's perfect, really. Just a moment - I'll be able to work this one quickly.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
[Start of Line]: Player passes object to Dammon. He inspects it (only if we can convey this without showing the object since design needs to be able to iterate it)

[End of Line]: Dammon turns to his forging equipment and does some, uh, general forging. Shouldn't show weapon specifically and can be handled with a generic.
(CINEMATIC DUPE OF N86)
EditorData.SFXTags: [WLZX]  Foley on Dammon hammering weapon sound

Text.Value: I found some hellish masks, can you make anything of these?
Actually, I'll hang on to them.
If you need something sharp, I have a few things left.
There you are. And be careful who you show that to. It might draw the wrong kind of attention.
I've got nine masks for you.
'Interesting' materials? What do you mean?
I... hesitated to mention this back in the druids' grove - for obvious reasons - but no one has earned my trust if not you.
Sounds like you had an interesting time in the Hells.
There you are! I'd hoped you'd made it through, but when we didn't hear from you... well. I'm glad you're here now.
I think I found a material you could work with. What can you make of it?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Player has special hellish metal in inventory

Text.Value: I thought it was you - saving my skin again, I see. Never seen a shapeshifted ox before, but I'm glad you dealt with it before it dealt with us.
That's not as many as you said you had.
I found this metal in a place called Grymforge - what do you make of it?
Leave.
I hope that fight with that hideous shapeshifted creature didn't sully your weapon too badly. You'll be needing it.
I can sense some, smell it almost, somewhere in the area. Underground, maybe - out there, in the shadows.
Nor from shapeshifting cow-blob-things, though you made short enough work of that one. Glad you handled it before it handled me.
Gods above and devils below! That ox was a bloody shapeshifter! Thanks for handling it.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.

Text.Value: Glad you and Karlach are all right. Well - as all right as any of us.

When Elturel was dragged into Avernus, I was drafted into a devil's smithy. It should have been awful, but infernal metal is like a wild horse. Powerful, exuberant - it'll kill you if you lack technique.
There. Be careful who sees you using that, might draw the wrong sort of eyes.
I'm glad to see you're all right. The way here was anything but easy, eh?
As for me, I won't say I enjoyed my time there, but it was certainly... instructional.

EditorData.NodeContext: He secretly did enjoy it but it would be very gauche to say so

Text.Value: Absolutely. Rare to get your hands on this stuff - well done keeping it to hand.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
[Start of Line]: Player passes object to Dammon. He inspects it (only if we can convey this without showing the object since design needs to be able to iterate it)

[End of Line]: Dammon turns to his forging equipment and does some, uh, general forging. Shouldn't show weapon specifically and can be handled with a generic.
(CINEMATIC DUPE OF N86)
EditorData.SFXTags: [WLZX]  Foley on Dammon hammering weapon sound

Text.Value: If you find it, bring it to me. I'll make something incredible.
Let's see what you have.
Merregon masks are brittle, so what I make won't last as long as my usual pieces.

EditorData.SFXTags: [WLZX]  Foley on Dammon hammering weapon sound

Text.Value: I'll be here if you need anything else.
Need anything?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.

Text.Value: I've got this metal I found in Avernus itself - will that do?
Using something that's already fabricated is tough, but I can try. How many do you have?
Fair enough, they might have use as they are.
I can spare two.
Nowhere's safe from this damned Absolute.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.

Text.Value: Here's one mask.
A makeshift Harper's fire might not be where I hoped to set up shop, but maybe I've got something you can use anyway.
Perhaps you've misplaced it? I'll be here should you find it again.
Isobel said we ought to sit tight for the time being - wait until we hear back from Jaheira. I know she's right, but I can't wait to get moving.
It's - you! What are the odds? So glad you're all right. Well - as all right as any of us.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Not Met.

Text.Value: Some of us had it easier than others. The baker, the schoolmaster - when Elturel was swallowed up, they could do little but survive.
Can't sleep, so I might as well hammer. Need anything?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.

Text.Value: I've got three masks.
And if you find any interesting materials in need of working, I'm happy to help.

EditorData.NodeContext: Said with a slightly knowing tone

Text.Value: If you want me to have another look, you know where to find me.
Did you see it? The path of light? That's good, right? Means we might make it out of here alive.
Well, well, well... I knew I smelled something. And I know just what to do with it. One moment.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Dammon] recieves something while delivering line, turns to forge and then returns it to the player <Greg>, , *REUSE* [Player] CINE_ProduceInventory_StandL_01-03 <Lili>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
[Start of Line]: Player passes object to Dammon. He inspects it (only if we can convey this without showing the object since design needs to be able to iterate it)

[End of Line]: Dammon turns to his forging equipment and does some, uh, general forging. Shouldn't show weapon specifically and can be handled with a generic.
(CINEMATIC DUPE OF N115)
EditorData.SFXTags: [WLZX]  Foley on Dammon hammering weapon sound

Text.Value: Here's six masks I don't need.
Earlier, you mentioned you could work 'interesting' materials. What did you mean?

Synopsis: This is the Haven state and dialogue for Dammon if he is rescued and brought back to the inn. He can be traded with in certain states and can forge a weapon of hellish power if the player brings him the right material.
